title: Thunderbird IMAP Inbox empty even after account removal/re-addition
creator: luca.giorgetti6
content:
Hello,

I am experiencing a critical issue where all received emails for one specific IMAP account have disappeared from Thunderbird. They are NOT visible in the Unified Inbox, nor in the account's specific Inbox folder.

- The Inbox folder is completely empty (or only shows a single test email I just sent to myself).

- The emails are NOT visible on Webmail. All of them are stored in Gmail, which I'm willing to move away from. I already have toggled the "keep a copy of the message" in the mail settings in Gmail but nothing chanced.

- When I try to "Subscribe" to folders, the checkbox for "INBOX" is missing or grayed out.

- Thunderbird shows a notification for a new mail, the mail stays here for a few minutes, then it disappears.

- The test emails I sent a couple of hours ago already disappeared.

- This happens with only one specific email. All the others work fine.

What I have already tried:

- Removed and re-added the account entirely (multiple times). 

- Repaired the folder via Folder Properties > Repair Folder. 
- Checked for active Quick Filters (none are active).

- Verified Account Settings > Synchronization (set to "keep all messages local regardless of age").

- Tried toggling "Show only subscribed folders" in Advanced Server Settings.

Can someone please help?

Thank you
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;tb_version:147.0.1;os:Windows 11

title: Junk Mail Controls do not work with unified folders?
creator: chapf
content:
Is the feature supposed to behave this way? I find this rather tedious. Am I missing something here?

Current behavior:

My installation does not seem to automatically execute spam filtering for unified folders or saved searches. As soon as I manually select one of the included folders within - e.g. an individual mail acccount's inbox - the algorithm triggers and everything works as expected, but only for the one folder I clicked. This leaves me with having to click through all my mail accounts manually to make use of the adaptive junk mail controls function.

Expected behavior:

Selecting a unified folder triggers junk mail controls for all the included folders and moves messages to the respective junk folders automatically.
